modelisation.data

Interface Column

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SplitColumn

    public interface Column

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Column.Continuity
      Enum that describes a column's nature - continuous-valued vs discrete-valued.

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Zero-based index of the column in the training data set.

      • getHeader

        java.lang.String getHeader()
        The column's associated header/name.

      • isDiscrete

        boolean isDiscrete()
        Returns:
        true if this column is treated as discrete/categorical, false if it is treated as continuous-valued

      • canSetContinuity

        boolean canSetContinuity()
        Check if the continuity of this column is ambiguous or not.

        For example, a column with real-numbered values can not be treated as discrete, while a column with non-numerical string values (e.g. male/female) can never be treated as a continuous, numerical variable.

        Meanwhile, a column with just integer values could be interpreted both as a continuous (e.g. age in integral years) and as a discrete (e.g. a 0/1 boolean column) variable.

        Returns:
        true if the column can be interpreted both as discrete and as continuous

      • setContinuity

        void setContinuity(Column.Continuity continuity)
        Set the continuity nature of this column, as returned by isDiscrete().

        This method MUST NOT be called if canSetContinuity() returns false.

        Parameters:
        continuity - the new countinuity treatment to be applied

      • asDouble

        double[] asDouble()
        Get the column values as real numbers. Can only be used if isDiscrete() returns false.
        Returns:
        values as real numbers

      • asClasses

        int[] asClasses()
        Get the class/partition of each value in the column. The return value is an array of integers in the range [0,N), where N is classCount(), the total number of classes the column values can be in. Can only be used if isDiscrete() returns true.
        Returns:
        row classes
        See Also:
        classCount()

      • classCount

        int classCount()
        Get the number of distnict classes this column's values are divided into. It is guaranteed that the array returned by asClasses() contains **at most** this many distinct values, and that every value in said array is strictly smaller than this value.

        Can only be used if isDiscrete() returns true.

        Returns:
        row classes
        See Also:
        asClasses()

      • classLabel

        java.lang.String classLabel(int classId)
        Return the label for the given class of a discrete column. Can only be used if isDiscrete() returns true.
        Parameters:
        classId - the class ID in [0...N)
        Returns:
        class name/label
        See Also:
        asClasses(), classCount()

      • size

        default int size()
        Returns:
        count of valuet in the column

      • getValueAsString

        java.lang.String getValueAsString(int index)
        Return the string representation of the item at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - row index
        Returns:
        value as string

      • getValueAsNumber

        java.lang.Number getValueAsNumber(int index)
        Return the value at the given index as a number. Can only be called if isDiscrete() is false.
        Parameters:
        index - row index
        Returns:
        value as number

      • partial

        Column partial(int[] keepIndexes)
        Return a new column containing only the rows specified by keepIndexes.
        Parameters:
        keepIndexes - array of row indexes to keep
        Returns:
        the new column

      • partial

        default Column partial(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> keepIndexes)
        Return a new column containing only the rows specified by keepIndexes.
        Parameters:
        keepIndexes - array of row indexes to keep
        Returns:
        the new column
